description:
This module contains one variable declaration for each diagnostic of the
 http://jsoniq.org/errors namespace.
 The variables serves as documentation for the errors but can also
 be used in the code. For example, one useful scenario is to compare
 an error caught in the catch clause of a try-catch expression with one of
 the variables.

variables.name: jerr:JNDY0021
variables.description: parser error raised by jn:parse-json

variables.name: jerr:JNTY0021
variables.description: array or object selector on heterogeneous sequence

variables.name: jerr:JNTY0020
variables.description: parser error for invalid option type

variables.name: jerr:JNTY0024
variables.description: objects or arrays don't have a string value

variables.name: jerr:JNTY0023
variables.description:
It is a type error if the prefix is not a string or if the
 serialization parameters are not an element.

variables.name: jerr:JNUP0019
variables.description: It is a dynamic error if the content expression, in an object insert expression, does not evaluate to a sequence of objects.

variables.name: jerr:JNTY0018
variables.description: It is a dynamic error if there is not exactly one supplied parameter for an object or array selector.

variables.name: jerr:JNUP0017
variables.description: It is a dynamic error if the value in a replace expression is not exactly a single item.

variables.name: jerr:JNUP0016
variables.description: It is a dynamic error if it is attempted to create a replace, delete or rename update primitive with a selector that cannot be resolved against the target array or object.

variables.name: jerr:JNSE0022
variables.description:
It is a dynamic error to serialize a sequence that does
 not exist of exactly one document node with XML, HTML, XHTML, Text.

variables.name: jerr:JNSE0014
variables.description:
It is a dynamic error to serialize a function or a node with the
 JSON output method.

variables.name: jerr:JNSE0013
variables.description:
It is a dynamic error to serialize an atomic value not
 supported by JSON or a node with the JSON output method and with
 the jsoniq-serialization-extensions serialization parameter
 set to false.

variables.name: jerr:JNSE0012
variables.description:
It is a dynamic error to serialize a sequence of less
 or more than one item with the JSON output method if the
 jsoniq-serialization-multiple-items is set to no.

variables.name: jerr:JNTY0011
variables.description: It is a type error if the content sequence in a node constructor or in an XQUF insert or replace update expression contains an object or an array.

variables.name: jerr:JNUP0010
variables.description: It is a dynamic error if a pending update list contains two renaming update primitives on the same object and with the same selector.

variables.name: jerr:JNUP0009
variables.description: It is a dynamic error if a pending update list contains two replacing update primitives on the same object or array, and with the same selector.

variables.name: jerr:JNUP0008
variables.description:
It is a dynamic error if the target of a deleting or replacing expression is not an array or an object.
 It is a dynamic error if the target of a renaming expression is not an object.
 It is a dynamic error if the target of an appending expression is not an array.
 It is a dynamic error if the target of a position-inserting expression is not an array.
 It is a dynamic error if the target of a non-position-inserting expression is not an object.

variables.name: jerr:JNUP0007
variables.description: It is a type error if, in an updating expression, an array selector cannot be cast to xs:integer or if an object selector cannot be cast to xs:string.

variables.name: jerr:JNUP0006
variables.description: It is a dynamic error if upd:applyUpdates causes an object to contain two pairs with the same name.

variables.name: jerr:JNUP0005
variables.description: It is a dynamic error if a pending update list contains two inserting update primitives on the same object and pair name.

variables.name: jerr:JNTY0004
variables.description: It is a type error to call fn:data on a sequence containing an array or an object.

variables.name: jerr:JNDY0003
variables.description: It is a dynamic error if two pairs in an object constructor or in a simple object union have the same name.

variables.name: jerr:JNTY0002
variables.description: It is a type error if the right-hand-side expression of a pair constructor does not return exactly one item.
